column2: Invite §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! to your court with the following promises:
Add §Y[Root.GetFullName]§! to the list of titles currently being offered as a promise.
Remove §Y[Root.GetFullName]§! from the list of titles currently being offered as a promise.
Promise to press the next invitee's claim on §Y[Root.GetFullName]§! if applicable.
Remove the promise to press the next invitee's claim on §Y[Root.GetFullName]§!.
Adjust other promises being made to the next invitee.
Must NOT have already been invited with promises by [Root.GetHerHis] current liege.
Is NOT in a lesser union and in the same court as [Root.GetHerHis] spouse.
Cannot remove the last county if a higher tier title is also promised.
Must promise to grant a county before promising a higher tier title.
The promises made to §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! will be shown in the §GTooltip§! of the option of the event.
§Y[Root.GetFullName]§! is currently being offered as a promise.
Has NOT already been been promised to someone.[lmmiwp_get_currently_promised_to]
Has designated at least one thing for offering as a promise.
I reside at a higher court
Low chance of winning a war against §Y[From.lmmiwp_promised_title_to_press_claim.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName]§!
I am satisfied with my current situation
Promised to press my claim on §Y[From.lmmiwp_promised_title_to_press_claim.GetFullName]§!
I am afraid of new places
I would like to be on §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§!'s council
I would like to be on a higher tier council
I want to lead an army
I am already heir to something better
[lmmiwp_inviter.GetTitledName] has invited me to [lmmiwp_inviter.GetHerHis] court with promises.

To the [GetFromRootCompliment] [lmmiwp_inviter.GetFirstName],

I have accepted your invitation and have left the court of my old liege to join yours. I hereby request that you honor your word and fulfill the promises you made to me!

Regards,
[From.GetTitledName]

To the [GetFromRootCompliment] [lmmiwp_inviter.GetFirstName],

It has been [local_lmmiwp_years_waited.GetValue] [lmmiwp_get_year_or_years] since I have been waiting for you to fulfill the promises you made to me. I request that you honor your word and fulfill them now!

Regards,
[From.GetTitledName]

To [lmmiwp_inviter.GetTitledFirstName],

[lmmiwp_get_patiently_waited_or_came_all_the_way]. However, in light of the current circumstances, the promises you made to me can no longer be fulfilled. As such, I will consider your word broken!

Regards,
[From.GetTitledName]

To the [GetFromRootCompliment] [lmmiwp_inviter.GetFirstName],

During the time I have stayed at your court you have fulfilled all the promises you made to me when you first invited me. I expected nothing less from a [lmmiwp_inviter.GetLordLady] of your stature. Thank you!

Regards,
[From.GetTitledName]
Ask [From.GetHerHim] to have a little patience
Ask [From.GetHerHim] to wait a little more

To the [GetFromRootCompliment] [lmmiwp_inviter.GetFirstName],

What you ask is most reasonable. I shall be patient and not bother you with my requests for another year.

Regards,
[From.GetTitledName]

To [lmmiwp_inviter.GetTitledFirstName],

I do not know your true intentions, but I did not come all this way to be put aside, forgotten or perhaps manipulated. If you do not fulfill your promises immediately, I will consider your word broken!

Regards,
[From.GetTitledName]

To the [GetFromRootCompliment] [lmmiwp_inviter.GetFirstName],

I have already waited for [local_lmmiwp_years_waited.GetValue] [lmmiwp_get_year_or_years] and my patience has run out. If you are not willing to fulfill your promises immediately, I will consider your word broken!

Regards,
[From.GetTitledName]
I am finding it hard to remember the promises I made to [lmmiwp_invitee.GetTitledName] when I invited [lmmiwp_invitee.GetHerHim] to my court. Perhaps I should consult my records...
I have to think carefully about what other promises do I want to make to my next invitee.
Both Grant Council Position and Make Commander
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! has already broken [Root.GetHerHis] word by taking hostile actions against §Y[From.GetTitledName]§!. Hence, the promises can §Rno longer be fulfilled§!.
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§!'s any current primary war against §Y[lmmiwp_title_to_press_claim.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName]§! §Rwill end§! inconclusively!

§Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! declares war on §Y[lmmiwp_title_to_press_claim.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledName]§! for §Y[lmmiwp_invitee.GetTitledName]§!'s claim on §Y[lmmiwp_title_to_press_claim.GetFullName]§!.
The Press Claim promise is considered §Gfulfilled§! as §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! is already pressing §Y[From.GetTitledName]§!'s claim on §Y[lmmiwp_title_to_press_claim.GetFullName]§!.

As §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! is currently defending in a war against §Y[lmmiwp_title_to_press_claim.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledName]§! hence [Root.GetSheHe] cannot press the promised claim yet but can ask §Y[From.GetTitledName]§! to give [Root.GetHerHim] some more time.
§Y[From.GetTitledName]§! accepts and waits for 1 more year.
All of our direct vassals who will be §Gde jure vassals§! of §Y[From.GetTitledName]§! will be transferred to [From.GetHerHim].
§Y[From.GetTitledName]§! will be granted an appropriate §Gcouncil position§! based on [From.GetHerHis] skills.
§Y[From.GetTitledName]§! will be appointed as a §Gcommander§! of §Y[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]§! skills.
Promised to press a claim against me
This character is known to have broken promises [Root.GetSheHe] made to invite someone to [Root.GetHerHis] court.
This character coaxed someone to join [Root.GetHerHis] court but proceeded to either imprison or kill that person.
This character invited someone to [Root.GetHerHis] court and proceeded to immediately fulfill all promises made to that person.
Invited characters may accept or reject requests to wait additional years for the promises to be fulfilled based on their traits, the inviter's traits, time already waited and other factors.
Invited characters will always accept the request to wait additional years.
Promises will have to be fulfilled immediately after inviting a character. The character cannot be asked to wait additional years.
I have waited patiently for [local_lmmiwp_years_waited.GetValue] [lmmiwp_get_year_or_years] for you to honor your word
I trusted your word came all the way to your court.
